Package Controllers

Class MenuController

java.lang.Object
Controllers.MenuController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants, IMenu
public class MenuController extends Object implements IMenu
Controls the instantiation of Menu instances for this application.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface Interfaces.Constants

    APPLICATION_TYPE, COMPANY_NAME, DB_PROPERTIES_FILE, DOUBLE_LINE, SINGLE_LINE, TERMINAL_WIDTH, USER_FORCEFULLY_ABORTED_MESSAGE

  • Method Details

    • isDone

      public boolean isDone()
      Returns:
      true if the menuStack is empty; false if menuStack is not empty.

    • getInstance

      public static MenuController getInstance()
      Creates a new MenuFactory instance if no instance exists in this application; gets the instanceif an instance of MenuFactory already exists.
      Returns:
      The single MenuFactory instance in this running application.

    • getTotalMenusLoaded

      public int getTotalMenusLoaded()
      Returns:
      the total amount of Menu objects in the menuStack.

    • addMenu

      public void addMenu(Menu menu)
      Adds a menu to menuStack.
      Parameters:
      menu - to add.

    • popTop

      public void popTop()
      Removes the Menu at the top of the stack if the stack has more than one Menu.

    • clearStack

      public void clearStack()
      Clears menuStack.

    • getCurrent

      public Menu getCurrent()
      Returns:
      the Menu at the top of menuStack.

    • showCurrent

      public Menu showCurrent() throws IOException, Menu.InvalidSelectionException, IllegalStateException, InterruptedException
      Prints the current Menu to the console and uses Input.expect(String) to get a response from the user.
      Returns:
      the topmost menu in menuStack.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
      IllegalStateException - if no response is entered by the user.
      InterruptedException - if the user forces the program to stop.
      Menu.InvalidSelectionException
